common.metaTitle: Antelope Tools network monitors real-time infrastructure data for multiple Antelope and EOSIO chains.
common.metaDescription: Antelope Tools Dashboard is a network monitor featuring real-time data on block producer nodes and blockchain infrastructure for multiple Antelope and EOSIO chains.
common.translationInProgress: This translation is in progress, if you find an error please let us know.

routes./help>heading: Welcome to the Antelope Tools Help Center
routes./help>moreDescription: Check how the bp.json Standard is used, troubleshoot if BP data is missing and contact us if you have suggestions
routes.moreDescription: This is a read more text component for users that either need a bit of help or are new to the system. A clear but not too extensive set of terms and instructions can help users get going without having to over write titles or labels like the one on the search card below. Take a look! A third line is also possible and probably more than enough.
routes./rewards-distribution>moreDescription: A geographic visualization of daily block producer rewards and a list of undiscoverable paid block producers.
routes./undiscoverable-bps>moreDescription: A list of the paid block producers on the network which do not provide information in their BP.json files.
routes./bpjson>moreDescription: A tool for block producers to provide details of their organizations and nodes to comply with the BP information standard.
routes./node-config>moreDescription: Use this tool to obtain example config files to help configure a new node on the network.
routes./ricardian-contract>moreDescription: The on-chain ricardian contract that describes the validator node agreement of {{networkName}}.
routes./>moreDescription: Monitor the infrastructure of blockchain networks using Antelope + EOSIO blockchain technology.
routes./cpu-benchmark>moreDescription: A visualization of CPU usage in microseconds by block producer nodes accounts, with lowest, highest, and average usage data.
routes./block-producers>moreDescription: A list of the block producers in the network â€“ blockchain accounts registered to run nodes on the network. It includes information from chain tables and their bp.json files.
routes./block-producers/bpName>moreDescription: View block producer general information such as rank, rewards and compliance
routes./nodes>moreDescription: A list of all the nodes run by block producers comprising the network with specific information such as endpoints and location.
routes./endpoints>moreDescription: An updated list of public API endpoints provided by node operators and their health status.
routes./endpoints-stats>moreDescription: Response time statistics from Costa Rica and the availability of a producer's endpoints.
routes./nodes-distribution>moreDescription: A visualization of the geographic distribution of the nodes in this network.
routes./accounts>moreDescription: This tool helps find information about accounts and interact with contracts on the network. Enter an account name and obtain account information, smart contract actions, and table data.
routes./block-distribution>moreDescription: A visualization of the distribution of blocks produced by the nodes in the network.
routes./missed-blocks>moreDescription: A list of scheduled, produced, and missed blocks by each account in the network.
routes./stress-test>moreDescription: Monitor current and historical data about transactions, such as resource utilization and all-time high TPS.

body.paragraph1: Welcome to Antelope Tools, your one-stop solution for real-time visualization and monitoring of Antelope and EOSIO blockchains. Designed to be the ultimate blockchain network monitoring tool, we provide real-time data analytics, Block Producer insights, and much more.

body1.paragraph1: is the dedicated team of blockchain experts behind Antelope Tools. With years of experience in blockchain technology and a passion for transparency and reliability, we aim to make the Web3 ecosystem more accessible and user-friendly. Our team is committed to continuous innovation, ensuring that Antelope Tools remains the leading Antelope blockchain network monitoring tool.

body2.paragraph1: Antelope Tools is a community-centric, open-source platform developed by blockchain enthusiasts committed to transparency and reliability. Our mission is to offer a user-friendly interface to access critical information about Block Producers, thereby fostering network transparency. Experience the difference by trying Antelope Tools today!

body3.paragraph1: Whether you're on the {{networkName}}, or any other EOSIO-based DPoS network,  token holders rely on available data to vote for Block Producers. In permissioned networks like LACChain, node operators must ensure seamless network functionality. Antelope Tools is your reliable source for objective data and node performance metrics.

body4.paragraph1: We offer rich, graphical insights into entities operating nodes and blockchain infrastructures. Our data is sourced directly from the public table of producers in the system contracts and is updated in real-time to focus only on active entities. We then use the bp.json standard to retrieve additional data from the Block Producers' URLs.

body5.paragraph1: Antelope Tools is generously funded through
body5.paragraph2: , a community-driven funding platform. This financial support enables us to maintain, improve, and expand our services. If you find value in what we do, consider supporting us in the next Pomelo Grant round to help us continue making blockchain networks more transparent and efficient.

body6.paragraph1: For more insights into Antelope Tools, check out our
body6.paragraph2: or join the conversation in our
body6.paragraph3: Become a part of our community and let's make blockchain networks more transparent and user-friendly together!

helpRoute.title: Thank You for Choosing Antelope Tools
helpRoute.paragraph: We're thrilled you've chosen Antelope Tools for your blockchain network monitoring needs.
helpRoute.title2: Configuring bp.json and chains.json Files: A Guide for Node Operators

body3.paragraph1Text1: Antelope Tools offers detailed, real-time visualization and analytics for entities running nodes and blockchain infrastructure. Our data is sourced directly on-chain from the public
body3.eosioAccount: producers table in the eosio system account.
body3.paragraph1Text2: We then query the URLs of all active Block Producers to retrieve essential information

helpRoute.subtitle3: Leveraging the bp.json Standard for Block Producer and Node Details
helpRoute.paragraph2: If you're a node operator and your data isn't displaying as it should on our dashboard, you'll need to configure your bp.json and chains.json files. Here's a step-by-step guide:
helpRoute.bullet1: Publish a /bp.json file on the website you used when registering via the 'regproducer' action on the eosio system contract. This file should include all pertinent information about your organization and the nodes you operate.
helpRoute.bullet2: If you're operating nodes on multiple EOSIO-based blockchains, you'll need a chains.json file. This file maps each network's chain ID to the appropriate bp.json file.
helpRoute.subBullet2b: , the system first tries to access
helpRoute.subBullet2c: . If this file is not available, it defaults to
helpRoute.bullet3: Ensure your chains.json file contains the chain ID for proper network identification. If the chain ID is missing, only your organizational details will be displayed, omitting nodes and endpoints.
helpRoute.title3: Utilize Our BP JSON Generator Tool
helpRoute.paragraph3: We offer a BP JSON generator tool to simplify the creation and updating of your bp.json file. This tool gathers your Block Producer information and generates a bp.json file in the correct format. It also enables on-chain publishing to the `producerjson` smart contract.
helpRoute.paragraph4: Your feedback is crucial as we aim to continually enhance our platform. Feel free to suggest improvements, report issues, or contribute to our codebase.
helpRoute.telegramChannel: Join the Conversation in Our Telegram Channel
helpRoute.websiteEOSCR: Discover Web3 Development Services by Edenia
